title: How to Bake a Rhubarb Cake

steps.headline: Preheat  the oven.
steps.description: For the temperature, follow the directions on the cake mix box.

steps.headline: Prepare the rhubarb.
steps.description: Wash the rhubarb and cut off any end pieces that are discolored; usually about 2 inches (5.1 cm) off each end.

steps.headline: Cut the rhubarb into 1 inch (2.5 cm) cubes.
Place the cubes of rhubarb into a medium saucepan.
steps.description: Pour in about ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm), covering the rhubarb and adding a little extra.

steps.headline: Add the cup of sugar.
Turn the stove onto medium high.
steps.description: Cook the rhubarb until it becomes tender. This will take about 7 to 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove the pan from the heat.
steps.description: Drain excess liquid if needed but a little liquid is okay.

steps.headline: Make the cake.
steps.description: While the rhubarb is cooking, prepare the cake mix according to the directions on the mixture box. Pour the mixed cake into the cake pan. Do not bake it yet.

steps.headline: Pour the pan of hot, cooked and softened rhubarb slowly and evenly over the top of the unbaked cake mixture.
steps.description: A little of the cooking liquid is okay for moisture but don't add too much.

steps.headline: Bake the cake in the oven.
steps.description: Follow the instructions given with the cake mix. To test when it is done, stick a toothpick into the middle of the cake; the cake is ready when the toothpick comes out clean.

steps.headline: Remove the baked cake from the oven with oven mitts.
steps.description: Allow the cake to cool in the pan for ten minutes, then remove and leave to cool on a wire cooling rack. Wait at least 20 minutes before serving.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Cut into slices and serve. While it is fine to serve as it is, you could also serve it with something extra, such as Cool Whip, whipped cream or a scoop or two of vanilla ice cream.

steps.headline: Prepare the baking pan by greasing it or lining with parchment paper.
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 325ºF/160ºC. If you haven't already prepared the rhubarb, do so now by washing it and cutting into small pieces.

steps.headline: Pour the milk and vinegar into a small jug or container.
steps.description: Stir to combine. Leave to one side.

steps.headline: Add the brown sugar, butter and egg to the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Stir to blend together.

steps.headline: Add the baking soda to the milk and vinegar mixture.
steps.description: Stir to dissolve into the liquid.

steps.headline: Pour the milk mixture into the brown sugar mixture.
steps.description: Stir to blend together.

steps.headline: Sift the flour into the batter.
steps.description: Add the vanilla extract. Stir to mix well.

steps.headline: Add the pieces of rhubarb.
steps.description: Stir through gently.

steps.headline: Transfer the batter to the prepared pan.
steps.description: Set aside for a moment while you prepare the topping.

steps.headline: Make the topping.
steps.description: Combine the sugar and cinnamon together. Sprinkle over the top of the cake batter, distributing it evenly and right to the edges.

steps.headline: Place into the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the middle of the cake comes out clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Allow to cool in the pan for five minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to finish cooling.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Cut into slices and serve as it is or with whipped cream or even some custard in a little bowl. This goes well with tea and coffee or can be enjoyed as a tasty dessert with some custard over the top.

text: Cake Mix Rhubarb Cake Preheat  the oven. For the temperature, follow the directions on the cake mix box. Prepare the rhubarb. Wash the rhubarb and cut off any end pieces that are discolored; usually about 2 inches (5.1 cm) off each end. Cut the rhubarb into 1 inch (2.5 cm) cubes.  Place the cubes of rhubarb into a medium saucepan. Pour in about ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm), covering the rhubarb and adding a little extra. Add the cup of sugar.  Turn the stove onto medium high. Cook the rhubarb until it becomes tender. This will take about 7 to 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat. Drain excess liquid if needed but a little liquid is okay. Make the cake. While the rhubarb is cooking, prepare the cake mix according to the directions on the mixture box. Pour the mixed cake into the cake pan. Do not bake it yet. Pour the pan of hot, cooked and softened rhubarb slowly and evenly over the top of the unbaked cake mixture. A little of the cooking liquid is okay for moisture but don't add too much. Bake the cake in the oven. Follow the instructions given with the cake mix. To test when it is done, stick a toothpick into the middle of the cake; the cake is ready when the toothpick comes out clean. Remove the baked cake from the oven with oven mitts. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for ten minutes, then remove and leave to cool on a wire cooling rack. Wait at least 20 minutes before serving. Serve. Cut into slices and serve. While it is fine to serve as it is, you could also serve it with something extra, such as Cool Whip, whipped cream or a scoop or two of vanilla ice cream. Rhubarb Cake from Scratch Prepare the baking pan by greasing it or lining with parchment paper. Preheat the oven to 325ºF/160ºC. If you haven't already prepared the rhubarb, do so now by washing it and cutting into small pieces. Pour the milk and vinegar into a small jug or container. Stir to combine. Leave to one side. Add the brown sugar, butter and egg to the mixing bowl. Stir to blend together. Add the baking soda to the milk and vinegar mixture. Stir to dissolve into the liquid. Pour the milk mixture into the brown sugar mixture. Stir to blend together. Sift the flour into the batter. Add the vanilla extract. Stir to mix well. Add the pieces of rhubarb. Stir through gently. Transfer the batter to the prepared pan. Set aside for a moment while you prepare the topping. Make the topping. Combine the sugar and cinnamon together. Sprinkle over the top of the cake batter, distributing it evenly and right to the edges. Place into the preheated oven. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the middle of the cake comes out clean. Remove from the oven. Allow to cool in the pan for five minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to finish cooling. Serve. Cut into slices and serve as it is or with whipped cream or even some custard in a little bowl. This goes well with tea and coffee or can be enjoyed as a tasty dessert with some custard over the top.
